meanings.definition: Allow or enable to escape or be set free.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper will release the rescued bird back into the wild.
meanings.sent2: The police officer will release the handcuffs once the suspect is in custody.
meanings.sent3: After being stuck in traffic for hours, the green light finally gave the cars a release.
meanings.sent4: The artist's new song will release a wave of emotions in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: With a deep breath, she felt the tension release from her shoulders.

meanings.definition: Make (a movie, recording, or other product) available to the public.
meanings.sent1: The film studio will release the highly anticipated movie next month.
meanings.sent2: The band will release their new album on all streaming platforms.
meanings.sent3: The bakery decided to release a limited edition cupcake flavor to the customers.
meanings.sent4: The author will release a new book that will captivate readers worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The company plans to release a new line of smartphones with advanced features.

meanings.definition: The action of releasing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The release of the hostages brought relief to their families.
meanings.sent2: The release of the new video game caused excitement among gamers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's final act involved a dramatic release of doves from his sleeves.
meanings.sent4: The release of the balloons symbolized the start of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The sudden release of pressure caused the container to burst open.
